item.title: DeAgentAI ecosystem product CorrAI and Blave reach strategic cooperation to promote the democratization of quantitative tradingOn July 24, CorrAI, the core product of the DeAgentAI ecosystem, announced a strategic partnership with the institutional-level data platform Blave. The two parties will integrate institutional-level derivatives data and code-free quantitative strategy building capabilities to provide users with a one-stop solution from data insights to executable trading strategies. The position concentration analysis, advanced filters and real-time warning functions provided by the Blave platform will be directly imported into CorrAI's visual strategy builder. With the guidance of the AI assistant Corr-GPT, users can quickly create strategies using key data such as whale behavior, long and short positions, and optimize them through indicators such as Sharpe ratio and maximum drawdown. The whole process does not require programming knowledge. The cooperation will also bring cross-platform benefits to users of both platforms: Blave users can access CorrAI's backtesting function through API, and CorrAI subscribers can unlock Blave's enhanced data layer. CorrAI is a quantitative trading product in the DeAgentAI ecosystem that focuses on de-FAI. It provides users with verifiable on-chain insights and intelligent strategy development capabilities through DeAgentAI's advanced multi-agent infrastructure. The product is committed to making quantitative trading more accessible to both novices and professional users, and helps users avoid common pitfalls such as overfitting through an integrated large language model. DeAgentAI is an AI Agent network infrastructure project built on multiple chain ecosystems such as Sui, BSC and BTC, with the core vision of "Make AI Smarter". It is committed to empowering on-chain transactions through AI prediction and feedback mechanisms, and has currently supported more than 190 million on-chain interactions, providing a smarter and more reliable AI-driven solution for the Web3 ecosystem. [PANews]

item.title: Crypto Innovation Council Appoints Ji Hun Kim as CEO, Adds SoFi as MemberOn July 24, the Cryptocurrency Innovation Council (CCI) announced today that the board of directors has appointed Ji Hun Kim as its chief executive officer (CEO). Kim has served as president and acting CEO of CCI since January 2025. He previously served as the organization's chief legal and policy officer. At the same time, SoFi, as an innovative company in the field of fintech and banking, officially joined the Crypto Innovation Council. [PANews]

item.title: Binance Now Supports USYC and cUSDO as OTC CollateralAccording to official sources, Binance is now officially expanding its institutional OTC settlement services, adding support for two tokenized real-world assets (RWA) as collateral: USYC and cUSDO. Institutional users can now use these yield-bearing tokenized stable assets as collateral through Banking Triparty custody and MirrorRSV, to trade securely on the Binance platform while maintaining off-exchange custody and optimizing capital efficiency. [Odaily]

item.title: deBridge Foundation Launches Reserve Fund, Repurchasing DBR Tokens with All Protocol RevenueThe deBridge Foundation has launched a reserve fund that allocates 100% of protocol revenue to repurchase its native DBR token on the open market. As of July 24, the fund has acquired 1.3% of the total DBR supply since its launch in June, worth nearly $3.00M. deBridge's overall treasury now holds $30.10M in assets, covering DBR, USDC, SOL, and ETH. In addition, the fund is exploring yield strategies and has launched a public dashboard to track assets and yields in real time. (The Block) [Odaily]

item.title:
deBridge launches Reserve Fund to buy back its DBR token with all protocol revenuedeBridge Foundation, the organization behind the popular bridge protocol, has unveiled a Reserve Fund that channels 100% of protocol revenue into open market purchases of its DBR token, part of an effort to establish long-term value and provide users with a line-of-sight into more than $30 million in DAO assets.
Since going live in June, the Reserve Fund has already acquired 1.3% of DBR’s total supply of 10 billion tokens, currently valued at nearly $3 million, the project informed The Block. The fund now sits alongside deBridge’s broader treasury, which holds $30.1 million across DBR, USDC, SOL, and ETH as of July 24, according to details shared by the foundation.
The initiative is also exploring yield-bearing strategies to increase the fund’s overall value. According to the project, Idle USDC stablecoins on Ethereum are deposited into lending protocol Aave, while ETH is staked via Lido’s platform. On Solana, SOL and native USDC are deployed on Kamino Finance to earn returns. A public dashboard has also been released, tracking every purchase, balance, and real-time yield, providing the community with an on-chain audit trail of the foundation’s balance sheet.
DBR is the native governance token of the deBridge protocol, which was introduced in late 2024 and issued on the Solana blockchain as an SPL token. Launched in early 2022, deBridge operates as a cross-chain liquidity transfer solution that connects multiple networks like Solana, Ethereum, and BNB Chain. It doesn’t require users to lock assets and receive an equivalent wrapped token, a popular bridging design regularly exploited by cybercriminals.
deBridge raised $5.5 million in funding from investors, including Animoca Brands and ParaFi Capital, back in 2021. According to DefiLlama data, deBridge has nearly $10 million in annualized fees, and its DBR coin has a market capitalization of over $80 million.
The buyback model echoes recent moves by dYdX, Pump.fun, Raydium, and other decentralized platforms that use protocol revenue to burn or accumulate native tokens in a bid to tie value directly to network activity and support ecosystem growth.

item.title: Solana developers are considering increasing network block capacity by 66%.As demand for block space grows, Solana developers are considering increasing the network's block capacity by 66%. According to a document released by core contributors this week, the new proposal SIMD-0286 proposes increasing the upper limit of compute units (CU) per Solana block from 60.00M to 100.00M. The proposal aims to allow Solana to handle more transactions and support more complex applications, such as decentralized exchanges (DEXs), MEV systems, and restaking protocols, without hitting the compute limit. (Coindesk) [Odaily]

item.title: XT Exchange Lists CTA (Cross The Ages)XT will list CTA (Cross The Ages) and open the CTA/USDT trading pair in the Innovation Zone (GameFi). Details are as follows: Deposit Time: July 23, 2025, 17:00 (UTC+8) Trading Time: July 24, 2025, 17:00 (UTC+8) Withdrawal Time: July 25, 2025, 17:00 (UTC+8) Cross The Ages (CTA) is a comprehensive intellectual property (IP) covering various media and entertainment formats. It aims to attract player communities by integrating the rich experiences of Web2 and Web3 ecosystems. CTA's product line includes: video games, books, movies/episodes, collectible models, peripheral merchandise, and derivatives. [Odaily News]

item.title: Everything Blockchain: Advancing the Construction of a Meme Coin Treasury and Launching MemeStrategy S-1 RegistrationUS-listed company Everything Blockchain has announced that the MemeStrategy spin-off has entered the next stage, with the company officially launching the S-1 registration process with the US Securities and Exchange Commission for MemeStrategy, with the aim of preparing for a subsequent Nasdaq listing through financing or strategic acquisitions. In addition, MemeStrategy will also advance its Meme coin acquisition strategy, including PEPE, BONK and SPX6900, to build the first Meme coin treasury of a US-listed company. (Globe newswire) Previous news, Everything Blockchain also announced plans to invest $10.00M in Solana (SOL), XRP, Sui (SUI), Bittensor (TAO) and Hyperliquid (HYPE) to create a multi-token staking vault for institutional adoption trends. [Odaily News]
